sentences: Ma palun pakk võid, kilo kohupiima.
Palume teid kõiki – ärge jätke meid hätta!
context: The Estonian verb 'paluma' is a versatile word that primarily means to ask for, request, beg, or pray. It can be used in various contexts: when asking for something physical like food or money; when making polite requests; when praying to God; when inviting people somewhere (like for dinner); and even as a polite formula in conversations. The word has different forms depending on conjugation - 'palun' for first person singular, 'palub' for third person singular, etc.
